title: PSA: There is this really cool feature in the game.
body:
If you press 4 by default, you can place a ward. Its super awesome how helpful a ward can be, you can dodge incoming ganks, catch people out of position and gain central knowledge of everyones whereabouts. So next time before you bitch about someone being trash in your game, make sure you dont have 4 ward score at 39 mins you bloody ape.

Thank you for listening. That is all.

> [{quoted}](name=keccak256,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nY0Wsmvn,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-01-28T15:39:08.378+0000)
>

> 
> thats the thing you dont use right?
> then blame jg when you get ganked?
> 
> and the things that take 3-10x longer to kill than a champ?

Its those things riot keeps nerfing so bot can't do anything but farm unless your teams jungler is there.

no no, wards are those things that spot the enemy midlaner leaving mid, entering the river, approach bot and kill you so you have plenty of time to ping you midlaner that he didnt told you and he didnt come even if he could have done nothing
Yasuo mains be like: Junglers are my ward because they dont do anything but get me vision

Not to mention: Wards are the best tanks in the game. Everyone that does not build to counter them (costing 2.9k Gold) needs 3 hits (or 4 for Control Wards POG) to kill them. for <1.0 AS mages this is 2-3 seconds longer then killing a marksman

i place the ward

but i dont look at the mini map

go figure
 {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

I always ping their warding totem whenever they complain about a lack of a missing ping or complaining about the lack of ganks by a jungler, or being camped by an enemy jungler. 

It's bizarre that at this point, people STILL think warding/vision control is something only a Support should do. You'd think they'd learn that sticking a control ward in their bush helps their Jungler gank their lane and gives everyone info where the enemy jungler is. Nope.

If they leave fountain with 75+ gold and an open item slot, one should just be forced unless you already have one up.
Well, since they increased CDs on warding trinkets, it is harder to keep a ward up consistently.  At the same time, if you aren't warding, don't be pushing, or be ready to burn your flash to escape.

> [{quoted}](name=Gramps69,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nY0Wsmvn,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2019-01-28T19:52:28.306+0000)
>
> Well, since they increased CDs on warding trinkets, it is harder to keep a ward up consistently.  At the same time, if you aren't warding, don't be pushing, or be ready to burn your flash to escape.

Then you'd use your intuition. If you're not pushing, you're not at any risk of being ganked, and thus don't need to ward if your trinket is on cooldown. Nobody is going to gank you under turret at full health, below level 6, and even with ults it'd still be risky. 

Nevertheless you should always be fighting for vision control of the lane, although this is easier to do while ahead of your laner. This isn't something only Supports do. Buy a control ward.

But what if I'm playing {{champion:157}}

What do I do then? {{champion:157}}

Useless PSA. Not because you are wrong but because no one will use your advice. I struggle with this every time I play support. ADC never wards early for jungler, jungler never wards early for himself, adc never wards brush in lane, and adc never wards tribush or river bush.

Despite seeing two active wards in their inventory and you pinging that yours is on cooldown. I give up

Next time on "Tips for fellow Summoners!":

**How to alt+F4 before you flame**
